active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, share real-world examples of exploited IDE plugin vulnerabilities (e.g., malicious VS Code extensions stealing credentials or IntelliJ plugins used in supply chain attacks). Debate: How do these fit into broader software supply chain risks like EO 14028 mandates? Propose one preventive measure per participant.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in IDE Plugin Security Assessment (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Software Development Security > Software Development Ecosystems > 003_Development Environment Security > IDE Security > IDE Plugin Security Assessment). Incorporate these elements: - Learning Objectives: [paste the 6 objectives above] - Active Learning: Use for higher-order cards (e.g., discussion-inspired analysis). - Scaffolding Layers: [paste the 4 layers above, including completed NIST C-SCRM, examples, sources]. Sources: NIST SSDF (https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-218.pdf), NIST C-SCRM SP 800-161r1 (https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-161r1.pdf), CISA KEV (https://www.cisa.gov/known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog), JetBrains Security (https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/security.html), VS Code Marketplace Risks (https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/extension-marketplace#_security). - Prior knowledge: Anchor to IDE basics, vulns. - Big picture: Secures dev ecosystems per EO 14028. Generate 25 high-quality flashcards following the Flashcard Schema exactly. Ensure progression: 5-8 per lower layers, increasing complexity. Use active recall, spaced repetition best practices (concise fronts, detailed backs). Vary formats. Output as a JSON array of card objects.
